descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: How US foreign policy is formulated, executed, legitimated, and contested. Topics include terrorism, democracy promotion, humanitarian intervention, economic sanctions, and US relations with Russia and China.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Bruce W. Jentleson, American Foreign Policy, 3rd Edition, W.W. Norton, 978-0-393-91943-1
